Table 02: USER DESCRIPTION

| Data Points | Answers |
| --- | --- |
| Summary | Susan is a 27-year-old graphic designer who works in the marketing department of a startup. She is passionate about creating beautiful designs that tell a story and help brands connect with their audience. She is always on the lookout for talented designers who can bring fresh ideas to the table. Susan is a busy professional who values her time and expects quality work that is delivered on time. |

Table 03: PSYCHOGRAPHICS

| Data Points | Answers |
| --- | --- |
| Personal Characteristics | Creative, detail-oriented, organized, innovative |
| Hobbies | Traveling, photography, painting, attending design events and conferences |
| Interests | Typography, color theory, user experience, branding |
| Personal Aspirations | To start her own design agency and work with big brands |
| Professional Goals | To expand her skill set and learn new design tools and techniques |
| Pains | Lack of time, limited budget, dealing with difficult clients, finding reliable and talented designers |
| Main Challenges | Balancing multiple projects at once, meeting tight deadlines, standing out in a crowded market |
| Needs | Quality work, timely delivery, clear communication, collaboration with skilled designers |
| Dreams | To create award-winning designs for big brands and make a name for herself in the industry |

Table 04: SHOPPING BEHAVIORS

| Data Points | Answers |
| --- | --- |
| Budget | $1000-$5000 per project |
| Shopping Frequency | As needed for specific projects, typically 2-3 times per year |
| Preferred Channels | Online search, referrals from colleagues and industry contacts |
| Online Behavior | Searches for designers and agencies with strong online portfolios and positive reviews, reads case studies and client testimonials, researches design trends and techniques |
| Search Terms | "Best graphic designers in [city]", "Top branding agencies in [market]", "Professional design services" |
| Preferred Brands | Designs for small businesses and startups |
| Triggers | Recommendations from colleagues and industry contacts, impressive portfolio and case studies, clear communication and project management process |
| Barriers | Limited budget, lack of trust in designers, difficult project requirements or deadlines |

To address Susan's main challenges, our design agency can offer clear communication and project management processes, timely delivery, and high-quality work that meets her expectations. We can also provide a team of skilled designers who can bring fresh ideas and help her stand out in a crowded market. Additionally, we can work within her budget to provide cost-effective design solutions that meet her needs.

Cold email template:

Subject: High-Quality Design Solutions for Busy Professionals

Dear Susan,

We understand that you're a busy professional who values quality work and clear communication. Our design agency offers high-quality design solutions for professionals like you who need creative and innovative designs that stand out in a crowded market.

With a team of skilled designers who are passionate about creating beautiful designs that tell a story, we can help you achieve your professional goals and bring your vision to life. We offer clear communication and project management processes, timely delivery, and cost-effective solutions that meet your budget.

Whether you need logo design, UI/UX, business card design, social media content design, copywriting, branding, or motion graphics design, we have the expertise to deliver quality work that meets your needs.

If you're interested in learning more about our design services, please feel free to reach out to us. We'd love to hear from you and see how we can help you achieve your design goals.

Best regards,

[Your Name]
